#Text=Nik & Eva Speakman
#Text=Nik Speakman
#Text=( born 7 December 1961 ) [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ] and Eva Speakman ( born 30 April 1969 ) , [ 3 ] [ 4 ] known collectively as The Speakmans , are British therapists and life coaches .
#Text=Career

#Text=Nik Speakman started a finance company , Personal Money Management , aged 26 with his former partner and was working as a success coach at the time of his and Eva 's 2005 appearance in That 's Rich , a Granada Television series focusing on entrepreneurs in the north west of England . [ 5 ]
#Text=Eva Speakman ran the Heavenly Bodies gym in Oldham , at the time of the show . [ 5 ]
#Text=The Speakmans were subsequently hosts of a Living TV show , A Life Coach Less Ordinary , and in 2007 published a book , You Can Be Fantastic , Too ! . [ 6 ]
#Text=The couple hosted a television pilot for the American FOX network , Panic Attack , in 2010 . [ 7 ]
#Text=A second daytime television show , The Speakmans , was broadcast by ITV .
#Text=In The Speakmans they attempted to ' successfully treat ordinary people with extraordinary problems ' . [ 8 ]
#Text=The show aired for 20 episodes , beginning on 14 July 2014 . [ 9 ]
#Text=The Speakmans are regular columnists in ' Love It Magazine ' .
#Text=The couple regularly appears on ITV ' s
#Text=This Morning
#Text=hosting a segment about anxiety issues and phobias .
#Text=The Speakmans use ' schema conditioning psychotherapy ' to ' find and tackle the root cause of anxiety disorders ' . [ 10 ]
#Text=Nik Speakman said of their approach on their television series that " We 're really hoping people will look at it and think :
